intro: Apolepsis repanda, commonly known as the broadleaf apolepsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic, a common trait among members of its family. Apolepsis repanda is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
